title: Drawing, A Winged Victory Inscribing the Date 1805 on a Shield, 1805
title_raw: A Winged Victory Inscribing the Date 1805 on a Shield
medium: Pen and black ink on paper
markings: On verso, in black ink, lower right: Cooper Union stamp: MUSEUM / FOR THE / ARTS OF / DECORATION / COOPER UNION (Lugt 457c)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: A female genius is shown in profile turned toward right and writing upon a shield, “1805,” which like other weapons stands upon a pedestal. The framing line is divided into 6 parts above and below, in somewhat more than 7 parts laterally. The divisions and figures are written with graphite.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, A Winged Victory Inscribing the Date 1805 on a Shield, 1805. Pen and black ink on paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3251
